Assert.ArrayAssert.name: Assert.ArrayAssert

containsMatch.description:
Asserts that a value matching some condition is present in an array. This uses
a function to determine a match.
containsMatch.param: {Function} matcher A function that returns true if the items matches or false if not.

params.name: matcher
params.description: A function that returns true if the items matches or false if not.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

doesNotContain.description:
Asserts that a value is not present in an array. This uses the triple equals 
Asserts that a value is not present in an array. This uses the triple equals 
sign so no type cohersion may occur.
doesNotContain.param: {Object} needle The value that is expected in the array.

params.name: needle
params.description: The value that is expected in the array.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

indexOf.description:
Asserts that the given value is contained in an array at the specified index.
This uses the triple equals sign so no type cohersion will occur.
indexOf.param: {Object} needle The value to look for.

params.name: needle
params.description: The value to look for.

params.name: haystack
params.description: The array to search in.

params.name: index
params.description: The index at which the value should exist.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

itemsAreSame.description:
Asserts that the values in an array are the same, and in the same position,
as values in another array. This uses the triple equals sign
so no type cohersion will occur. Note that the array objects themselves
need not be the same for this test to pass.
itemsAreSame.param: {Array} expected An array of the expected values.

params.name: expected
params.description: An array of the expected values.

params.name: actual
params.description: Any array of the actual values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

contains.description:
Asserts that a value is present in an array. This uses the triple equals 
sign so no type cohersion may occur.
contains.param: {Object} needle The value that is expected in the array.

params.name: needle
params.description: The value that is expected in the array.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

containsItems.description:
Asserts that a set of values are present in an array. This uses the triple equals 
sign so no type cohersion may occur. For this assertion to pass, all values must
be found.
containsItems.param: {Object[]} needles An array of values that are expected in the array.

params.name: needles
params.description: An array of values that are expected in the array.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values to check.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

doesNotContainItems.description:
Asserts that a set of values are not present in an array. This uses the triple equals 
sign so no type cohersion may occur. For this assertion to pass, all values must
not be found.
doesNotContainItems.param: {Object[]} needles An array of values that are not expected in the array.

params.name: needles
params.description: An array of values that are not expected in the array.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values to check.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

itemsAreEquivalent.description:
Asserts that the values in an array are equivalent, and in the same position,
as values in another array. This uses a function to determine if the values
are equivalent. Note that the array objects themselves
need not be the same for this test to pass.
itemsAreEquivalent.param: {Array} expected An array of the expected values.

params.name: expected
params.description: An array of the expected values.

params.name: actual
params.description: Any array of the actual values.

params.name: comparator
params.description:
A function that returns true if the values are equivalent
or false if not.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

itemsAreEqual.description:
Asserts that the values in an array are equal, and in the same position,
as values in another array. This uses the double equals sign
so type cohersion may occur. Note that the array objects themselves
need not be the same for this test to pass.
itemsAreEqual.param: {Array} expected An array of the expected values.

params.name: expected
params.description: An array of the expected values.

params.name: actual
params.description: Any array of the actual values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

isEmpty.description: Asserts that an array is empty.

params.name: actual
params.description: The array to test.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

lastIndexOf.description:
Asserts that the given value is contained in an array at the specified index,
starting from the back of the array.
This uses the triple equals sign so no type cohersion will occur.
lastIndexOf.param: {Object} needle The value to look for.

params.name: needle
params.description: The value to look for.

params.name: haystack
params.description: The array to search in.

params.name: index
params.description: The index at which the value should exist.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

isNotEmpty.description: Asserts that an array is not empty.

params.name: actual
params.description: The array to test.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

doesNotContainMatch.description:
Asserts that no values matching a condition are present in an array. This uses
a function to determine a match.
doesNotContainMatch.param: {Function} matcher A function that returns true if the items matches or false if not.

params.name: matcher
params.description: A function that returns true if the items matches or false if not.

params.name: haystack
params.description: An array of values.

params.name: message
params.description: (Optional) The message to display if the assertion fails.

The ArrayAssert object provides functions to test JavaScript array objects
for a variety of cases.

This event fires when the value of the element changes, either as a result of
a keystroke, or from an input event.

element of type text and password. This event only occurs when the element

Rating.name: Rating

elements.description: NodeList of elements used on the Rating. Each element is one Star.

labelNode.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.

defaultSelected.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.

inputName.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.

value.description: Stores the value of the current selected Rating element.

label.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.

disabled.description:
Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow
hover or click, just display selected stars.

hiddenInput.description:
Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input
replace the radio elements and keep the same name.

selectedIndex.description: Stores the index of the selected element.

title.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.

size.description: Number of Rating elements to be displayed.

showTitle.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.

canReset.description: If true could be reseted (i.e., have no values selected).

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Rating, providing:
  • A non-obstrusive star rating control
  • Could be based on a set of radio input boxes
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Rating({
boundingBox: '#rating',
defaultSelected: 3,
disabled: false,
label: 'Label'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Rating.

ArrayList.name: ArrayList

params.name: items
params.description: array of items this list will be responsible for

constructors.description:
Generic ArrayList class for managing lists of items and iterating operations
over them.  The targeted use for this class is for augmentation onto a
class that is responsible for managing multiple instances of another class
(e.g. NodeList for Nodes).  The recommended use is to augment your class with
ArrayList, then use ArrayList.addMethod to mirror the API of the constituent
items on the list's API.
The default implementation creates immutable lists, but mutability can be
provided via the arraylist-add submodule or by implementing mutation methods
directly on the augmented class's prototype.

return.description: Array index if found.  Otherwise -1

indexOf.description: Finds the first index of the needle in the managed array of items.
indexOf.param: needle { mixed } The item to search for

params.name: needle
params.description: The item to search for

return.description: True if the function returned true on an item

some.description:
Execute a function on each item of the list, optionally providing a custom execution context. Default context is the item.

The callback signature is callback( item, index ).

Unlike each, if the callback returns true, the iteratation will stop.
some.param: fn { Function } the function to execute

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: context
params.description: optional override 'this' in the function

addMethod.description:
Adds a pass through method to dest (typically the prototype of a list class) that calls the named method on each item in the list with whatever parameters are passed in. Allows for API indirection via list instances.

Accepts a single string name or an array of string names.

list.each( function ( item ) {
item.methodName( 1, 2, 3 );
} );
// becomes
list.methodName( 1, 2, 3 );

Additionally, the pass through methods use the item retrieved by the _item method in case there is any special behavior that is appropriate for API mirroring.
addMethod.param: dest { Object } Object or prototype to receive the iterator method

params.name: dest
params.description: Object or prototype to receive the iterator method

params.name: name
params.description: Name of method of methods to create

return.description: the item at the requested index

item.description:
Get an item by index from the list.  Override this method if managing a
list of objects that have a different public representation (e.g. Node
instances vs DOM nodes).  The iteration methods that accept a user
function will use this method for access list items for operation.

params.name: i
params.description: index to fetch

return.description: true if 1 or more items are being managed

isEmpty.description: Is this instance managing any items?

return.description: this instance

each.description:
Execute a function on each item of the list, optionally providing a custom execution context. Default context is the item.

The callback signature is callback( item, index ).
each.param: fn { Function } the function to execute

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: context
params.description: optional override 'this' in the function

return.description: The item appropriate for pass through API methods

_item.description: Protected method for optimizations that may be appropriate for API mirroring. Similar in functionality to item, but is used by methods added with ArrayList.addMethod().
_item.param: i { Integer } Index of item to fetch

params.name: i
params.description: Index of item to fetch

return.description: Number of items in the list

size.description: How many items are in this list?

ArrayList.description:
Generic ArrayList class for managing lists of items and iterating operations
over them.  The targeted use for this class is for augmentation onto a
class that is responsible for managing multiple instances of another class
(e.g. NodeList for Nodes).  The recommended use is to augment your class with
ArrayList, then use ArrayList.addMethod to mirror the API of the constituent
items on the list's API.
The default implementation creates immutable lists, but mutability can be
provided via the arraylist-add submodule or by implementing mutation methods
directly on the augmented class's prototype.

Loader.name: Loader

params.name: o
params.description:
an optional set of configuration options. Valid options:
  • base: The base dir
  • comboBase: The YUI combo service base dir. Ex: http://yui.yahooapis.com/combo?
  • root: The root path to prepend to module names for the combo service. Ex: 2.5.2/build/
  • filter: A filter to apply to result urls. This filter will modify the default path for all modules. The default path for the YUI library is the minified version of the files (e.g., event-min.js). The filter property can be a predefined filter or a custom filter. The valid predefined filters are:
    DEBUG
    Selects the debug versions of the library (e.g., event-debug.js). This option will automatically include the Logger widget
    RAW
    Selects the non-minified version of the library (e.g., event.js).
    You can also define a custom filter, which must be an object literal containing a search expression and a replace string: 
    myFilter: { 
'searchExp': "-min\\.js", 
'replaceStr': "-debug.js"
}
  • filters: per-component filter specification. If specified for a given component, this overrides the filter config
  • combine: Use the YUI combo service to reduce the number of http connections required to load your dependencies
  • ignore: A list of modules that should never be dynamically loaded
  • force: A list of modules that should always be loaded when required, even if already present on the page
  • insertBefore: Node or id for a node that should be used as the insertion point for new nodes
  • charset: charset for dynamic nodes (deprecated, use jsAttributes or cssAttributes)
  • jsAttributes: object literal containing attributes to add to script nodes
  • cssAttributes: object literal containing attributes to add to link nodes
  • timeout: number of milliseconds before a timeout occurs when dynamically loading nodes. in not set, there is no timeout
  • context: execution context for all callbacks
  • onSuccess: callback for the 'success' event
  • onFailure: callback for the 'failure' event
  • onCSS: callback for the 'CSSComplete' event. When loading YUI components with CSS the CSS is loaded first, then the script. This provides a moment you can tie into to improve the presentation of the page while the script is loading.
  • onTimeout: callback for the 'timeout' event
  • onProgress: callback executed each time a script or css file is loaded
  • modules: A list of module definitions. See Loader.addModule for the supported module metadata

constructors.description:
Loader dynamically loads script and css files.  It includes the dependency
info for the version of the library in use, and will automatically pull in
dependencies for the modules requested.  It supports rollup files and will
automatically use these when appropriate in order to minimize the number of
http connections required to load all of the dependencies.  It can load the
files from the Yahoo! CDN, and it can utilize the combo service provided on
this network to reduce the number of http connections required to download 
YUI files.
While the loader can be instantiated by the end user, it normally is not.

Loader.see:
YUI.use for the normal use case.  The use function automatically will
pull in missing dependencies.

the CSS is loaded first, then the script.  This provides a moment you can tie into to improve
the presentation of the page while the script is loading.

addModule.description:
Add a new module to the component metadata.         
<dl>
<dt>name:</dt>       <dd>required, the component name</dd>
<dt>type:</dt>       <dd>required, the component type (js or css)</dd>
<dt>path:</dt>       <dd>required, the path to the script from "base"</dd>
<dt>requires:</dt>   <dd>array of modules required by this component</dd>
<dt>optional:</dt>   <dd>array of optional modules for this component</dd>
<dt>supersedes:</dt> <dd>array of the modules this component replaces</dd>
<dt>after:</dt>      <dd>array of modules the components which, if present, should be sorted above this one</dd>
<dt>rollup:</dt>     <dd>the number of superseded modules required for automatic rollup</dd>
<dt>fullpath:</dt>   <dd>If fullpath is specified, this is used instead of the configured base + path</dd>
<dt>skinnable:</dt>  <dd>flag to determine if skin assets should automatically be pulled in</dd>
<dt>submodules:</dt> <dd>a hash of submodules</dd>
<dt>lang:</dt>       <dd>array of BCP 47 language tags of
languages for which this module has localized resource bundles,
e.g., ["en-GB","zh-Hans-CN"]</dd>
</dl>
addModule.param: o An object containing the module data

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the module data

params.description: the module name (optional), required if not in the module data

been loaded (which is usually why it is time to load the next

</dl>

A list of modules that should always be loaded, even

maxURLLength.description:
Max url length for combo urls.  The default is 2048 for
internet explorer, and 8192 otherwise.  This is the URL
limit for the Yahoo! hosted combo servers.  If consuming
a different combo service that has a different URL limit
it is possible to override this default by supplying 
the maxURLLength config option.  The config option will
only take effect if lower than the default.
Browsers:
IE: 2048
Other A-Grade Browsers: Higher that what is typically supported 
'capable' mobile browsers: @TODO
Servers:
Apache: 8192

overrides the filter config.

loaded.description:
Set when beginning to compute the dependency tree. 
Composed of what YUI reports to be loaded combined
with what has been loaded by any instance on the page
with the version number specified in the metadata.

_internalCallback.description:
Internal callback to handle multiple internal insert() calls
so that css is inserted prior to js

inserted.description: List of modules inserted by the utility

charset.description: The charset attribute for inserted nodes

loadOptional.description:
Whether or not to load optional dependencies for 
the requested modules

ignoreRegistered.description: Ignore modules registered on the YUI global

attaching.description:
A list of modules to attach to the YUI instance when complete.
If not supplied, the sorted list of dependencies are applied.

combine.default: true if a base dir isn't in the config
combine.description:
If configured, the loader will attempt to use the combo
service for YUI resources and configured external resources.

filter.description:
A filter to apply to result urls. This filter will modify the default path for all modules. The default path for the YUI library is the minified version of the files (e.g., event-min.js). The filter property can be a predefined filter or a custom filter. The valid predefined filters are:
DEBUG
Selects the debug versions of the library (e.g., event-debug.js). This option will automatically include the Logger widget
RAW
Selects the non-minified version of the library (e.g., event.js).
You can also define a custom filter, which must be an object literal containing a search expression and a replace string: 
myFilter: { 
'searchExp': "-min\\.js", 
'replaceStr': "-debug.js"
}

comboBase.description: Base path for the combo service

skipped.description:
List of skipped modules during insert() because the module
was not defined

context.description: The execution context for all callbacks

insertBefore.description: Node reference or id where new nodes should be inserted before

jsAttributes.description: An object literal containing attributes to add to script nodes

sorted.description:
All of the derived dependencies in sorted order, which
will be populated when either calculate() or insert()
is called

data.description: Data that is passed to all callbacks

ignore.description:
A list of modules that should not be loaded, even if
they turn up in the dependency tree

patterns.description:
If a module name is predefined when requested, it is checked againsts
the patterns provided in this property.  If there is a match, the
module is added with the default configuration.
At the moment only supporting module prefixes, but anticipate supporting
at least regular expressions.

dirty.description:
Flag to indicate the dependency tree needs to be recomputed
if insert is called again.

timeout.description:
Timeout value in milliseconds.  If set, self value will be used by
the get utility.  the timeout event will fire if
a timeout occurs.

root.description:
Root path to prepend to module path for the combo
service

Loader.description:
Loader dynamically loads script and css files.  It includes the dependency
info for the version of the library in use, and will automatically pull in
dependencies for the modules requested.  It supports rollup files and will
automatically use these when appropriate in order to minimize the number of
http connections required to load all of the dependencies.  It can load the
files from the Yahoo! CDN, and it can utilize the combo service provided on
this network to reduce the number of http connections required to download 
YUI files.
While the loader can be instantiated by the end user, it normally is not.

LiveSearch.name: LiveSearch

hide.description:
Function to be executed to hide the node when the data of that node
not matches with the filter.

show.description:
Function to be executed to show the node when the data of that node
matches with the filter.

delay.description:
Number of milliseconds the filter will be applied to the node list
after the user stop typing.

matchRegex.description: The input value need to matches with this RegExp to be accept as a filter (i.e., in order to accept only digits you could use /\d+/g).

input.description: The value of this input node is used to filter the results.

nodes.description: Nodes to be indexed for the filtering.

data.description:
Function to extract the content from the node for the indexing. The default uses the node.html(). In case if you need to index the id of the nodes, here goes one example:

Example indexing the id of the node instead of the HTML: 
function(node) {
return node.attr('id');
}

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for LiveSearch, providing:
  • Real-time filtering for DOM elements based on a input query
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.LiveSearch({
input: '#input',
nodes: '#search .entry'
});
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for LiveSearch.

Resize.name: Resize

activeHandle.description: Stores the active handle during the resize.

activeHandleEl.description: Stores the active handle element during the resize.

wrapper.description: Element to wrap the wrapTypes. This element will house the handles elements.

node.description: The selector or element to resize. Required.

wrapTypes.description:
Elements that requires a wrapper by default. Normally are elements
which cannot have children elements.

maxWidth.description: The maximum width of the element

tickY.description: The number of y ticks to span the resize to.

tickX.description: The number of x ticks to span the resize to.

minHeight.description: The minimum height of the element

maxHeight.description: The maximum height of the element

minWidth.description: The minimum width of the element

handles.description:
The handles to use (any combination of): 't', 'b', 'r', 'l', 'bl',
'br', 'tl', 'tr'. Can use a shortcut of All.

preserveRatio.description: Maintain the element's ratio when resizing.

autoHide.description:
False to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, true to
display them only when the user mouses over the resizable borders.

resizing.description: True when the element is being Resized.

wrap.description: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false) in favor of the handles config option. The wrapper element type (default div) could be over-riden passing the wrapper attribute.

proxyEl.default: Generated using an internal HTML markup

constrain.description:
Will attempt to constrain the resize node to the boundaries. Arguments:
'view': Contrain to Viewport
'#selector_string': Constrain to this node
'{Region Object}': An Object Literal containing a valid region (top, right, bottom, left) of page positions

proxy.description: Resize a proxy element instead of the real element.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Resize, providing:
  • Basic Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Applies drag handles to an element to make it resizable
  • Here is the list of valid resize handles: [ 't', 'tr', 'r', 'br', 'b', 'bl', 'l', 'tl' ]. You can read this list as top, top-right, right, bottom-right, bottom, bottom-left, left, top-left.
  • The drag handles are inserted into the element and positioned absolute. Some elements, such as a textarea or image, don't support children. To overcome that, set wrap:true in your config and the element willbe wrapped for you automatically.
Quick Example: 
var instance = new A.Resize({
node: '#resize1',
proxy: true,
preserveRatio: true,
wrap: true,
maxHeight: 170,
maxWidth: 400,
handles: 't, tr, r, br, b, bl, l, tl'
});
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Resize.

Resize.description:
A base class for Resize, providing:
  • Basic Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Applies drag handles to an element to make it resizable
  • Here is the list of valid resize handles: [ 't', 'tr', 'r', 'br', 'b', 'bl', 'l', 'tl' ]. You can read this list as top, top-right, right, bottom-right, bottom, bottom-left, left, top-left.
  • The drag handles are inserted into the element and positioned absolute. Some elements, such as a textarea or image, don't support children. To overcome that, set wrap:true in your config and the element willbe wrapped for you automatically.
Quick Example: 
var instance = new A.Resize({
node: '#resize1',
proxy: true,
preserveRatio: true,
wrap: true,
maxHeight: 170,
maxWidth: 400,
handles: 't, tr, r, br, b, bl, l, tl'
});
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Resize.

addAttr.description:
Adds an attribute with the provided configuration to the host object.

The config argument object supports the following properties:

value <Any>
The initial value to set on the attribute
valueFn <Function | String>

A function, which will return the initial value to set on the attribute. This is useful for cases where the attribute configuration is defined statically, but needs to reference the host instance ("this") to obtain an initial value. If defined, valueFn has precedence over the value property.

valueFn can also be set to a string, representing the name of the instance method to be used to retrieve the value.

readOnly <boolean>
Whether or not the attribute is read only. Attributes having readOnly set to true cannot be modified by invoking the set method.
writeOnce <boolean>
Whether or not the attribute is "write once". Attributes having writeOnce set to true, can only have their values set once, be it through the default configuration, constructor configuration arguments, or by invoking set.
setter <Function | String>

The setter function used to massage or normalize the value passed to the set method for the attribute. The value returned by the setter will be the final stored value. Returning Attribute.INVALID_VALUE, from the setter will prevent the value from being stored.

setter can also be set to a string, representing the name of the instance method to be used as the setter function.

getter <Function | String>

The getter function used to massage or normalize the value returned by the get method for the attribute. The value returned by the getter function is the value which will be returned to the user when they invoke get.

getter can also be set to a string, representing the name of the instance method to be used as the getter function.

validator <Function | String>

The validator function invoked prior to setting the stored value. Returning false from the validator function will prevent the value from being stored.

validator can also be set to a string, representing the name of the instance method to be used as the validator function.

broadcast <int>
If and how attribute change events for this attribute should be broadcast. See CustomEvent's broadcast property for valid values. By default attribute change events are not broadcast.
lazyAdd <boolean>
Whether or not to delay initialization of the attribute until the first call to get/set it. This flag can be used to over-ride lazy initialization on a per attribute basis, when adding multiple attributes through the addAttrs method.

The setter, getter and validator are invoked with the value and name passed in as the first and second arguments, and with the context ("this") set to the host object.

Configuration properties outside of the list mentioned above are considered private properties used internally by attribute, and are not intended for public use.

Attribute._ATTR_CFG.description:
The list of properties which can be configured for 
each attribute (e.g. setter, getter, writeOnce etc.).
This property is used internally as a whitelist for faster
Y.mix operations.

Attribute.INVALID_VALUE.description:
The value to return from an attribute setter in order to prevent the set from going through.

You can return this value from your setter if you wish to combine validator and setter functionality into a single setter function, which either returns the massaged value to be stored or Attribute.INVALID_VALUE to prevent invalid values from being stored.

Attribute.description:
Attribute provides configurable attribute support along with attribute change events. It is designed to be augmented on to a host class, and provides the host with the ability to configure attributes to store and retrieve state, along with attribute change events.

For example, attributes added to the host can be configured:

  • As read only.
  • As write once.
  • With a setter function, which can be used to manipulate values passed to Attribute's set method, before they are stored.
  • With a getter function, which can be used to manipulate stored values, before they are returned by Attribute's get method.
  • With a validator function, to validate values before they are stored.

See the addAttr method, for the complete set of configuration options available for attributes

.

NOTE: Most implementations will be better off extending the Base class, instead of augmenting Attribute directly. Base augments Attribute and will handle the initial configuration of attributes for derived classes, accounting for values passed into the constructor.

State.name: State

constructors.description:
The State class maintains state for a collection of named items, with 
a varying number of properties defined.
It avoids the need to create a separate class for the item, and separate instances 
of these classes for each item, by storing the state in a 2 level hash table, 
improving performance when the number of items is likely to be large.

addAll.param: name {String} The name of the item.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item.

params.name: o
params.description: A hash of property/value pairs.

addAll.description: Adds multiple properties to an item.

return.description: The value of the supplied property.

get.description: For a given item, returns the value of the property requested, or undefined if not found.
get.param: name {String} The name of the item

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item

params.name: key
params.description: Optional. The property value to retrieve.

return.description: An object with property/value pairs for the item.

getAll.description:
For the given item, returns a disposable object with all of the
item's property/value pairs.
getAll.param: name {String} The name of the item

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item

remove.param: name {String} The name of the item.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item.

params.name: key
params.description: The property to remove.

remove.description: Removes a property from an item.

removeAll.param: name {String} The name of the item.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item.

params.name: o
params.description: Collection of properties to delete. If not provided, the entire item is removed.

removeAll.description: Removes multiple properties from an item, or remove the item completely.

add.param: name {String} The name of the item.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the item.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property.

params.name: val
params.description: The value of the property.

CustomEvent.name: CustomEvent

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event, which is passed to the callback
when the event fires

params.name: o
params.description: configuration object

constructors.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

return.description: An object with a detach method to detch the handler(s)

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: context
params.description: optional execution context.

params.name: arg*
params.description:
0..n additional arguments to supply to the subscriber
when the event fires.

params.name: s
params.description: the subscriber

params.name: args
params.description: the arguments array to apply to the listener

return.description: return value from the monitor event subscription

monitor.description:
Monitor the event state for the subscribed event.  The first parameter
is what should be monitored, the rest are the normal parameters when
subscribing to an event.

params.name: what
params.description: what to monitor ('detach', 'attach', 'publish')

params.name: subscriber
params.description: object

return.description:
false if one of the subscribers returned false, 
true otherwise

fire.description:
Notifies the subscribers. The callback functions will be executed from the context specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The type of event
  • All of the arguments fire() was executed with as an array
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method
fire.param:
{Object*} arguments an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed
handle Unsubscribe handle

after.description:
Listen for this event after the normal subscribers have been notified and
the default behavior has been applied.  If a normal subscriber prevents the 
default behavior, it also prevents after listeners from firing.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: context
params.description: optional execution context.

params.name: arg*
params.description:
0..n additional arguments to supply to the subscriber
when the event fires.

applyConfig.param: o hash of properties to apply

params.name: o
params.description: hash of properties to apply

params.name: force
params.description:
if true, properties that exist on the event 
will be overwritten.

applyConfig.description: Apply configuration properties.  Only applies the CONFIG whitelist

preventDefault.description: Prevents the execution of this event's defaultFn

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed
Unsubscribe handle

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

return.description: or null

getSubscriber.description:
Returns the first subscriber that matches the provided function and/or
context.  Both function and context parameters are optional.  Omitting
either will return the first match on the other parameter, and omitting both
will return the first subscriber.
getSubscriber.param: fn {Function} Optional. The subscribed callback function

params.name: fn
params.description: Optional. The subscribed callback function

params.name: ctx
params.description: Optional.  The context override for the callback

halt.param:
immediate {boolean} if true additional listeners
on the current target will not be executed

params.name: immediate
params.description:
if true additional listeners
on the current target will not be executed

halt.description:
Stops the event propagation and prevents the default
event behavior.

return.description: returns the number of subscribers unsubscribed

unsubscribe.param:
{Function} fn  The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: context
params.description: The context object passed to subscribe.

stopImmediatePropagation.description:
Stops propagation to bubble targets, and prevents any remaining
subscribers on the current target from executing.

return.description: first item is the on subscribers, second the after

getSubs.description: Get all of the subscribers to this event and any sibling event

return.description: returns the number of subscribers unsubscribed

detach.param:
{Function} fn  The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: context
params.description: The context object passed to subscribe.

params.name: msg
params.description: message to log

params.name: cat
params.description: log category

log.description: Logger abstraction to centralize the application of the silent flag

fired.description: This event has fired if true

monitored.description: Monitor when an event is attached or detached.

silent.description:
By default all custom events are logged in the debug build, set silent
to true to disable debug outpu for this event.

firedWith.description:
An array containing the arguments the custom event
was last fired with.

preventable.description:
Specifies whether or not this event's default function
can be cancelled by a subscriber by executing preventDefault() 
on the event facade

stoppedFn.description:
The function to execute if a subscriber calls
stopPropagation or stopImmediatePropagation

type.description: The type of event, returned to subscribers when the event fires

defaultFn.description:
The default function to execute after event listeners
have fire, but only if the default action was not
prevented.

prevented.description:
Flag for preventDefault that is modified during fire().
if it is not 0, the default behavior for this event

queuable.description:
Specifies whether this event should be queued when the host is actively
processing an event.  This will effect exectution order of the callbacks
for the various events.

host.description:
Specifies the host for this custom event.  This is used
to enable event bubbling

emitFacade.description:
If set to true, the custom event will deliver an EventFacade object
that is similar to a DOM event object.

bubbles.description:
Specifies whether or not a subscriber can stop the event propagation
via stopPropagation(), stopImmediatePropagation(), or halt()
Events can only bubble if emitFacade is true.

broadcast.description:
If 0, this event does not broadcast.  If 1, the YUI instance is notified
every time this event fires.  If 2, the YUI instance and the YUI global
(if event is enabled on the global) are notified every time this event
fires.

fireOnce.description:
This event should only fire one time if true, and if
it has fired, any new subscribers should be notified
immediately.

preventedFn.description:
The function to execute if a subscriber calls
preventDefault

stopped.description:
Flag for stopPropagation that is modified during fire()
1 means to stop propagation to bubble targets.  2 means
to also stop additional subscribers on this target.

context.description:
The context the the event will fire from by default.  Defaults to the YUI
instance.

signature.description:
Supports multiple options for listener signatures in order to
port YUI 2 apps.

async.description:
fireOnce listeners will fire syncronously unless async
is set to true

CustomEvent.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

asyncMode.description:
Defines request/response management in the following manner:
<dl>
<!--<dt>queueRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, wait until response is
returned before sending the next request.</dd>
<dt>cancelStaleRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, cancel it before
sending the next request.</dd>-->
<dt>ignoreStaleResponses</dt>
<dd>Send all requests, but handle only the response for the most
recently sent request.</dd>
<dt>allowAll</dt>
<dd>Send all requests and handle all responses.</dd>
</dl>

generateRequestCallback.description:

param/value string that gets appended to the script URI. Implementers
can customize this string to match their server's query syntax.

Plugin.Align.name: Plugin.Align

to.parm:
region {String || Node || HTMLElement || Object} The node or
region to align with. Defaults to the viewport region.
to.description:
Aligns node with a point on another node or region.
Possible alignment points are:
<dl>
<dt>tl</dt>
<dd>top left</dd>
<dt>tr</dt>
<dd>top right</dd>
<dt>bl</dt>
<dd>bottom left</dd>
<dt>br</dt>
<dd>bottom right</dd>
<dt>tc</dt>
<dd>top center</dd>
<dt>bc</dt>
<dd>bottom center</dd>
<dt>rc</dt>
<dd>right center</dd>
<dt>lc</dt>
<dd>left center</dd>
<dt>cc</dt>
<dd>center center</dd>
</dl>

center.parm:
region {Node || HTMLElement || Object} optional The node or
region to align with. Defaults to the viewport region.
the window is resized. If centering to viewport, this defaults
to true, otherwise default is false.
center.description: Aligns the center of a node to the center of another node or region.

destroy.description:
Removes the resize handler, if any. This is called automatically
when unplugged from the host node.

Plugin.Align.description:
Node plugin which can be used to align a node with another node,
region, or the viewport.

DD.Drop.name: DD.Drop

node.description: Y.Node instanace to use as the element to make a Drop Target

useShim.description: Use the Drop shim. Default: true

padding.description: CSS style padding to make the Drop Target bigger than the node.

groups.description: Array of groups to add this drop into.

lock.description: Set to lock this drop element.

bubbles.description: Controls the default bubble parent for this Drop instance. Default: Y.DD.DDM. Set to false to disable bubbling. Use bubbleTargets in config.

constructors.description: Provides the ability to create a Drop Target.

_groups.description: The groups this target belongs to.

_valid.description: Flag for determining if the target is valid in this operation.

shim.description: Node reference to the targets shim

region.description: A region object associated with this target, used for checking regions while dragging.

_bubbleTargets.description: The default bubbleTarget for this object. Default: Y.DD.DDM

overTarget.description: This flag is tripped when a drag element is over this target.

_handleOutEvent.description: Handles the mouseout DOM event on the Target Shim

_createShim.description: Creates the Target shim and adds it to the DDM's playground..

params.description: The groups to check against

A base class for NestedList, providing:

return.description: An object containing profile data for a given function.

getFunctionReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for a single function.
The object has an entry for min, max, avg, calls, and points).

pause.description: Pauses profiling information for a given name.
pause.param: {String} name The name of the data point.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: An object containing profile data for a given function.

getReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for a single function.
The object has an entry for min, max, avg, calls, and points).

start.description:
Start profiling information for a given name. The name cannot be the name
of a registered function or object. This is used to start timing for a
particular block of code rather than instrumenting the entire function.
start.param: {String} name The name of the data point.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: An object containing all profile data.

getFullReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for all of the functions 
that were profiled. The object has an entry for each function and 
returns all information (min, max, average, calls, etc.) for each
function.

unregisterFunction.description: Removes a constructor function from profiling. Reverses the registerConstructor() method.
unregisterFunction.param:
{String} name The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

params.name: name
params.description:
The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

clear.description: Removes all report data from the profiler.
clear.param:
{String} name (Optional) The name of the report to clear. If
omitted, then all report data is cleared.

params.name: name
params.description:
(Optional) The name of the report to clear. If
omitted, then all report data is cleared.

stop.description: Stops profiling information for a given name.
stop.param: {String} name The name of the data point.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: The number of times the function was called.

getCallCount.description: Returns the number of times that the given function has been called.
getCallCount.param: {String} name The name of the function whose data should be returned.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the function whose data should be returned.

registerFunction.description:
Sets up a function for profiling. It essentially overwrites the function with one
that has instrumentation data. This method also creates an entry for the function
in the profile report. The original function is stored on the container object.
registerFunction.param:
{String} name The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

params.name: name
params.description:
The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

params.name: owner
params.description:
(Optional) The object that owns the function. If the function
isn't global then this argument is required. This could be the namespace that
the function belongs to or the object on which it's
a method.

params.name: registerPrototype
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates that the prototype should
also be instrumented. Setting to true has the same effect as calling
registerConstructor().

return.description: An instrumented version of the function.

instrument.description: Instruments a method to have profiling calls.
instrument.param: {String} name The name of the report for the function.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the report for the function.

params.name: method
params.description: The function to instrument.

return.description: The uninstrumented version of a function/object.

getOriginal.description: Returns the uninstrumented version of a function/object.
getOriginal.param: {String} name The name of the function/object to retrieve.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the function/object to retrieve.

return.description: The average time it takes the function to execute.

getAverage.description:
Returns the average amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

return.description: The minimum time it takes the function to execute.

getMin.description:
Returns the minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

unregisterObject.description:
Unregisters an object for profiling. It takes the object and looks for functions.
When a function is found, unregisterMethod() is called on it. If set to recrusive
mode, it will also unregister objects found inside of this object, 
using the same methodology.
unregisterObject.param: {String} name The name of the object to unregister.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to unregister.

params.name: recurse
params.description:
(Optional) Determines if subobject methods should also be
unregistered.

return.description: The maximum time it takes the function to execute.

getMax.description:
Returns the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

registerConstructor.description: Sets up a constructor for profiling, including all properties and methods on the prototype.
registerConstructor.param: {string} name The fully-qualified name of the function including namespace information.

params.name: name
params.description: The fully-qualified name of the function including namespace information.

params.name: owner
params.description: (Optional) The object that owns the function (namespace or containing object).

registerObject.description:
Sets up an object for profiling. It takes the object and looks for functions.
When a function is found, registerMethod() is called on it. If set to recrusive
mode, it will also setup objects found inside of this object for profiling, 
using the same methodology.
registerObject.param: {String} name The name of the object to profile (shows up in report).

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to profile (shows up in report).

params.name: owner
params.description: (Optional) The object represented by the name.

params.name: recurse
params.description: (Optional) Determines if subobject methods are also profiled.

last.description: Get the last in the queue. LIFO support

params.description: the item to search for

remove.param: item {MIXED} an item in the queue

params.name: item
params.description: an item in the queue

return.description: the next item in the queue

add.description: Add 0..n items to the end of the queue

promote.param: item {MIXED} an item in the queue

size.description: Returns the current number of queued items

Queue.description:
A simple FIFO queue.  Items are added to the Queue with add(1..n items) and
removed using next().

_areFoldTriggersSet.description: Boolean tracking whether the window scroll and window resize triggers have been set if this is a fold group.

The maximum pixel height of the document that has been made visible.
During fold checks, if the user scrolls up then there's no need to check for newly exposed images.

_imgObjs.description: Collection of images (Y.ImgLoadImgObj objects) registered with this group, keyed by DOM id.

_classImageEls.description: DOM elements having the class name that is associated with this group. Elements are stored during the _foldCheck function and reused later during any subsequent _foldCheck calls - gives a slight performance improvement when the page fold is repeatedly checked.

_triggers.description: Collection of triggers for this group. Keeps track of each trigger's event handle, as returned from Y.on.

_className.description: Keep the CSS class name in a member variable for ease and speed.

_timeout.description: Timeout object to keep a handle on the time limit.

_setFoldTriggers.description: Sets the window scroll and window resize triggers for any group that is fold-conditional (i.e., has a fold distance set).

_init.description: Initialize all private members needed for the group.

_clearTriggers.description: Clears the timeout and all triggers associated with the group.

return.description: group's fetch method

_getFetchTimeout.description: Returns the group's fetch method, with the proper closure, for use with setTimeout.

_onloadTasks.description:
Performs necessary setup at domready time.
Initiates time limit for group; executes the fold check for the images.

return.description: Y.ImgLoadImgObj that was registered

registerImage.description: Registers an image with the group. Arguments are passed through to a Y.ImgLoadImgObj constructor; see that class' attribute documentation for detailed information. "domId" is a required attribute.
registerImage.param: {Object} * A configuration object literal with attribute name/value pairs (passed through to a Y.ImgLoadImgObj constructor)

params.description: A configuration object literal with attribute name/value pairs (passed through to a Y.ImgLoadImgObj constructor)

_foldCheck.description: Checks the position of each image in the group. If any part of the image is within the specified distance (foldDistance) of the client viewport, the image is fetched immediately.

fetch.description:
Displays the images in the group.
This method is called when a trigger fires or the time limit expires; it shouldn't be called externally, but is not private in the rare event that it needs to be called immediately.

_fetchByClass.description: Finds all elements in the DOM with the class name specified in the group. Removes the class from the element in order to let the style definitions trigger the image fetching.

className.description: Class name that will identify images belonging to the group. This class name will be removed from each element in order to fetch images. This class should have, in its CSS style definition, "background:none !important;".

timeLimit.description: Time limit, in seconds, after which images are fetched regardless of trigger events.

foldDistance.description:
Distance below the fold for which images are loaded. Images are not loaded until they are at most this distance away from (or above) the fold.
This check is performed at page load (domready) and after any window scroll or window resize event (until all images are loaded).

name.description: Name for the group. Only used to identify the group in logging statements.

ImgLoadGroup.description: A group for images. A group can have one time limit and a series of triggers. Thus the images belonging to this group must share these constraints.

SliderValueRange.name: SliderValueRange

max.description: The value associated with the farthest bottom, right position of the rail. Can be less than the configured min if you want values to increase from right-to-left or bottom-to-top.

value.description:
The value associated with the thumb's current position on the
rail. Defaults to the value inferred from the thumb's current
position. Specifying value in the constructor will move the
thumb to the position that corresponds to the supplied value.

min.description: The value associated with the farthest top, left position of the rail. Can be greater than the configured max if you want values to increase from right-to-left or bottom-to-top.

Verifies that the current value is within the min - max range.  If
not, value is set to either min or max, depending on which is
closer.

Move the thumb to appropriate position if necessary.  Also resets
the cached offsets and recalculates the conversion factor to
translate position to value.

Update position according to new max value.  If the new max results
in the current value being out of range, the value is set to the
closer of min or max.

from the thumbMove event.

_nearestValue.description:
Returns the nearest valid value to the value input.  If the provided
value is outside the min - max range, accounting for min > max
scenarios, the nearest of either min or max is returned.  Otherwise,
the provided value is returned.
_nearestValue.param: value { mixed } Value to test against current min - max range

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test against current min - max range

_calculateFactor.description:
Calculates and caches
(range between max and min) / (rail length)
for fast runtime calculation of position -> value.

_afterMinChange.description:
Update position according to new min value.  If the new min results
in the current value being out of range, the value is set to the
closer of min or max.

params.name: e
params.description: The min attribute change event.

return.description: Value corresponding to the provided pixel offset

_offsetToValue.description:
Converts a pixel position into a value. Calculates current thumb offset from the leading edge of the rail multiplied by the ratio of (max - min) / (constraining dim).

Override this if you want to use a different value mapping algorithm.

output formatting. Otherwise equivalent to slider.get( "value" );

you need to set something up during the initializer phase.

_factor.description: Factor used to translate value -> position -> value.

By default, values range between 0 and 100, but you can configure these on the built Slider class by setting the min and max configurations. Set the initial value (will cause the thumb to move to the appropriate location on the rail) in configuration as well if appropriate.

Event.define.description:
Static method to register a synthetic event definition and implementation in the DOM Event subsystem.

Pass either a string type and configuration object as separate parameters or a configuration object that includes a type property as a single parameter.

The configuration object should include implementation methods for on and detach. This is the full list of configuration properties:

type
Required if using the Y.Event.define( config ) signature. The name of the synthetic event. What goes node.on(HERE, callback ).
on
function ( node, subscription, fireEvent ) The implementation logic for subscription. Any special setup you need to do to create the environment for the event being fired. E.g. native DOM event subscriptions. Store subscription related objects and information on the subscription object. When the criteria have been met to fire the synthetic event, call fireEvent.fire().
detach
function ( node, subscription, fireEvent ) The implementation logic for cleaning up a detached subscription. E.g. detach any DOM subscriptions done in on.
publishConfig
(Object) The configuration object that will be used to instantiate the underlying CustomEvent. By default, the event is defined with emitFacade: true so subscribers will receive a DOM-like event object.
processArgs
function ( argArray ) Optional method to extract any additional arguments from the subscription signature. Using this allows on signatures like node.on( "hover", overCallback, outCallback ). Be sure that the args passed in is pruned of any additional arguments using, for example, argArray.splice(2,1);. Data returned from the function will be stored on the subscription object passed to on and detach under subscription._extra.
Event.define.param: type {String} Name given to the synthetic event

params.name: type
params.description: Name given to the synthetic event

params.description: configuration object. Pass this as the first parameter if it includes the type property.

onAvailable.description:
Executes the supplied callback when the item with the supplied id is found. This is meant to be used to execute behavior as soon as possible as the page loads. If you use this after the initial page load it will poll for a fixed time for the element. The number of times it will poll and the frequency are configurable. By default it will poll for 10 seconds.

The callback is executed with a single parameter: the custom object parameter, if provided.

{string||string[]}   id the id of the element, or an array
of ids to look for.

with, but the preferred way to remove listeners is using the handle
that is returned when using Y.on

increased if additional late-bound handlers are requested after
the page load.

POLL_RETRYS.description:
The number of times we should look for elements that are not
in the DOM at the time the event is requested after the document
has been loaded.  The default is 1000@amp;40 ms, so it will poll
for 40 seconds or until all outstanding handlers are bound
(whichever comes first).

_wrappers.description:
Custom event wrappers for DOM events.  Key is 
'event:' + Element uid stamp + event type

_loadComplete.description: True after the onload event has fired

_el_events.description:
Custom event wrapper map DOM events.  Key is 
Element uid stamp.  Each item is a hash of custom event
wrappers as provided in the _wrappers collection.  This
provides the infrastructure for getListeners.

lastError.description:
addListener/removeListener can throw errors in unexpected scenarios.
These errors are suppressed, the method returns false, and this property
is set

Event.description:
The event utility provides functions to add and remove event listeners,
event cleansing.  It also tries to automatically remove listeners it
registers during the unload event.

Plugin.NodeFX.name: Plugin.NodeFX
Plugin.NodeFX.description: Binds an Anim instance to a Node instance

IORequest.name: IORequest

responseData.description: This is a normalized attribute for the response data. It's useful to retrieve the correct type for the dataType (i.e., in json requests the responseData) is a JSONObject.

transaction.description: Stores the IO Object of the current transaction.

dataType.description: The type of the request (i.e., could be xml, json, javascript, text).

cfg.description: Object containing all the IO Configuration Attributes. This Object is passed to the A.io internally.
cfg.default: Object containing all the IO Configuration Attributes.

cache.description: If false the current timestamp will be appended to the url, avoiding the url to be cached.

autoLoad.description: If true invoke the start method automatically, initializing the IO transaction.

uri.description: URI to be requested using AJAX.

headers.description: Set the correct ACCEPT header based on the dataType.

active.description: Whether the transaction is active or not.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for IORequest, providing:
  • Response data normalization for XML, JSON, JavaScript
  • Cache options
Quick Example:
A.io.request(uri, config);
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for IORequest.

IORequest.description:

  • Response data normalization for XML, JSON, JavaScript
  • Cache options
Quick Example:
A.io.request(uri, config);
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for IORequest.

Calendar.name: Calendar

dates.description: Dates which the calendar will show as selected by default.

setValue.description: If true set the selected date with the correct dateFormat to the value of the input field which is hosting the Calendar.

dateFormat.description: The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to A.DataType.Date.format.

selectMultipleDates.description: Wether accepts to select multiple dates.

firstDayOfWeek.description: First day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1.

maxDate.description:
Maximum allowable date. Values supported by the Date
constructor are supported.

stack.description: If true is able to do stacking with another overlays.

minDate.description:
Minimum allowable date. Values supported by the Date
constructor are supported.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Calendar, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Setting Configuration Options
  • Obtaining Selected Dates
  • Creating International Calendars
  • Customizing the Calendar
Quick Example: 
var instance = new A.Calendar({
trigger: '#input1',
dates: ['09/14/2009', '09/15/2009'],
dateFormat: '%d/%m/%y %A',
setValue: true,
selectMultipleDates: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Calendar.

_getDayName.description: Get the day name of the passed weekDay from the locale map.

_getLocaleMap.description:
Get the locale map containing the respective values for the locale used. 
A.DataType.Date.Locale['pt-br'] = A.merge(
A.DataType.Date.Locale['en'], {

Calendar.description:
A base class for Calendar, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Setting Configuration Options
  • Obtaining Selected Dates
  • Creating International Calendars
  • Customizing the Calendar
Quick Example: 
var instance = new A.Calendar({
trigger: '#input1',
dates: ['09/14/2009', '09/15/2009'],
dateFormat: '%d/%m/%y %A',
setValue: true,
selectMultipleDates: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Calendar.

UA.name: UA

secure.description: Set to true if the page appears to be in SSL

ie.description: Internet Explorer version number or 0.  Example: 6

air.description:
Adobe AIR version number or 0.  Only populated if webkit is detected.
Example: 1.0

mobile.description:
The mobile property will be set to a string containing any relevant
user agent information when a modern mobile browser is detected.
Currently limited to Safari on the iPhone/iPod Touch, Nokia N-series
devices with the WebKit-based browser, and Opera Mini.

os.description: The operating system.  Currently only detecting windows or macintosh

webkit.description:
AppleWebKit version. KHTML browsers that are not WebKit browsers will evaluate to 1, other browsers 0. Example: 418.9 
Safari 1.3.2 (312.6): 312.8.1 <-- Reports 312.8 -- currently the 
latest available for Mac OSX 10.3.
Safari 2.0.2:         416     <-- hasOwnProperty introduced
Safari 2.0.4:         418     <-- preventDefault fixed
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 418.9.1 <-- One version of Safari may run
different versions of webkit
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 419     <-- Tiger installations that have been
updated, but not updated
to the latest patch.
Webkit 212 nightly:   522+    <-- Safari 3.0 precursor (with native SVG
and many major issues fixed).
Safari 3.0.4 (523.12) 523.12  <-- First Tiger release - automatic update
from 2.x via the 10.4.11 OS patch
Webkit nightly 1/2008:525+    <-- Supports DOMContentLoaded event.
yahoo.com user agent hack removed.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Safari_version_history

gecko.description:
Gecko engine revision number. Will evaluate to 1 if Gecko is detected but the revision could not be found. Other browsers will be 0. Example: 1.8 
Firefox 1.0.0.4: 1.7.8   <-- Reports 1.7
Firefox 1.5.0.9: 1.8.0.9 <-- 1.8
Firefox 2.0.0.3: 1.8.1.3 <-- 1.81
Firefox 3.0   <-- 1.9
Firefox 3.5   <-- 1.91

chrome.description:
Chrome will be detected as webkit, but this property will also
be populated with the Chrome version number

UA.description:
YUI user agent detection.
Do not fork for a browser if it can be avoided.  Use feature detection when
you can.  Use the user agent as a last resort.  UA stores a version
number for the browser engine, 0 otherwise.  This value may or may not map
to the version number of the browser using the engine.  The value is 
presented as a float so that it can easily be used for boolean evaluation 
as well as for looking for a particular range of versions.  Because of this, 
some of the granularity of the version info may be lost (e.g., Gecko 1.8.0.9 
reports 1.8).

arrowRightEl.description: The element to be used as arrow right.

infoTemplate.description: String template used to display the information.

loader.description: HTML element to house the img which is being loaded.

infoEl.description: The element to be used as info.

preloadAllImages.description: Preload all images grabbed from the links attribute.

closeEl.description: The element to be used as close.

captionFromTitle.description: If true the caption will be pulled from the title DOM attribute.

imageAnim.description: Configuration attributes passed to the Anim class.

loading.description: Whether the image is during a loading state.

maxWidth.description: The maximum width of the element

arrowLeftEl.description: The element to be used as arrow left.

centered.description: If true the Overlay with the image will be positioned on the center of the viewport.

captionEl.description: The element to be used as caption.

loadingEl.description: The element to be used as loading.

maxHeight.description: The maximum height of the element

caption.description: The caption of the displayed image.

modal.description: Displays the modal OverlayMask on the viewport. Set to false to disable.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for ImageViewer, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Displays an image in a Overlay
  • Keyboard navigation support
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.ImageViewer({
links: '#gallery1 a',
caption: 'Liferay Champion Soccer',
captionFromTitle: true,
preloadNeighborImages: true,
preloadAllImages: true,
showInfo: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ImageViewer.

ImageViewer.description:
A base class for ImageViewer, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Displays an image in a Overlay
  • Keyboard navigation support
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.ImageViewer({
links: '#gallery1 a',
caption: 'Liferay Champion Soccer',
captionFromTitle: true,
preloadNeighborImages: true,
preloadAllImages: true,
showInfo: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ImageViewer.

YUI~array~invoke.name: YUI~array~invoke

return.description: All return values, indexed according to item index.

invoke.description:
Execute a named method on an array of objects. Items in the list that do not have a function by that name will be skipped. For example, Y.Array.invoke( arrayOfDrags, 'plug', Y.Plugin.DDProxy );

The return values from each call are returned in an array.
invoke.param: items { Array } Array of objects supporting the named method

params.name: items
params.description: Array of objects supporting the named method

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the method to execute on each item

params.name: args*
params.description:
Any number of additional args are passed as
parameters to the execution of the named method.

YUI~array~invoke.description: Adds the Y.Array.invoke( items, methodName ) utility method.

Whether this image has already been fetched.
In the case of fold-conditional groups, images won't be fetched twice.

_yPos.description: The vertical position returned from getY, to avoid repeat calls to access the DOM. The Y position is checked only for images registered with fold-conditional groups. The position is checked first at page load (domready) and this caching enhancement assumes that the image's vertical position won't change after that first check.

_getYPos.returns: {Object} The Y position of the image
_getYPos.description:
Gets the Y position of the node in page coordinates.
Expects that the page-coordinate position of the image won't change.

_getImgEl.returns: {Object} DOM element of the image as a Y.Node object
_getImgEl.description: Gets the object (as a Y.Node) of the DOM element indicated by "domId".

_init.description: Initialize all private members needed for the group.

return.description: Whether the image has been fetched (either during this execution or previously)

fetch.description:
Displays the image; puts the URL into the DOM.
This method shouldn't be called externally, but is not private in the rare event that it needs to be called immediately.
fetch.param: {Int} withinY  The pixel distance from the top of the page, for which if the image lies within, it will be fetched. Undefined indicates that no check should be made, and the image should always be fetched

params.name: withinY
params.description: The pixel distance from the top of the page, for which if the image lies within, it will be fetched. Undefined indicates that no check should be made, and the image should always be fetched

isPng.description:
Whether the image is a PNG.
PNG images get special treatment in that the URL is specified through AlphaImageLoader for IE, versions 6 and earlier.
Only used with background images.

srcUrl.description: Source URL for the image. For an image whose URL is specified by a "src" attribute in the DOM element.

enabled.description: AlphaImageLoader enabled property to be set for the image. Only set if isPng value for this image is set to true. Defaults to true.

domId.description: HTML DOM id of the image element.

height.description: Pixel height of the image. Will be set as a height attribute on the DOM element after the image is fetched. Defaults to the natural height of the image (no height attribute will be set). Usually only used with src images.

width.description: Pixel width of the image. Will be set as a width attribute on the DOM element after the image is fetched. Defaults to the natural width of the image (no width attribute will be set). Usually only used with src images.

sizingMethod.description: AlphaImageLoader sizingMethod property to be set for the image. Only set if isPng value for this image is set to true. Defaults to scale.

bgUrl.description: Background URL for the image. For an image whose URL is specified by "background-image" in the element's style.

setVisible.description: Whether the image's style.visibility should be set to visible after the image is fetched. Used when setting images as visibility:hidden prior to image fetching.

ImgLoadImgObj.description: Image objects to be registered with the groups

YUI~array~extras.name: YUI~array~extras

return.description:
true if every item in the array returns true
from the supplied function.

Array.every.description: Executes the supplied function on each item in the array.

params.name: a
params.description: the array to iterate

params.name: f
params.description: the function to execute on each item

params.name: o
params.description: Optional context object

return.description:
The items on which the supplied function
returned true. If no items matched an empty array is 
returned.

Array.filter.description:
Executes the supplied function on each item in the array.
Returns a new array containing the items that the supplied
function returned true for.

params.name: a
params.description: the array to iterate

params.name: f
params.description: the function to execute on each item

params.name: o
params.description: Optional context object

return.description:
An object with two members, 'matches' and 'rejects',
that are arrays containing the items that were selected or 
rejected by the test function (or an empty array).

Array.partition.description:
Partitions an array into two new arrays, one with the items
that match the supplied function, and one with the items that
do not.
Array.partition.paran:
f {Function} a function that will receive each item 
in the collection and its index.
Array.partition.param: a {Array} a collection to iterate over

params.name: a
params.description: a collection to iterate over

params.name: o
params.description: Optional execution context of f.

return.description:
The items on which the supplied function
returned false.

Array.reject.description:
The inverse of filter. Executes the supplied function on each item. 
Returns a new array containing the items that the supplied
function returned *false* for.

params.name: a
params.description: the array to iterate

params.name: f
params.description: the function to execute on each item

params.name: o
params.description: Optional context object

return.description:
All the items in the collection that 
produce a match against the supplied regular expression. 
If no items match, an empty array is returned.

Iterates over an array, returning a new array of all the elements
that match the supplied regular expression

params.description: a collection to iterate over

params.name: pattern
params.description:
The regular expression to test against 
each item

return.description:
A new array containing the return value
of the supplied function for each item in the original
array.

params.name: a
params.description: the array to iterate

params.name: f
