SyntheticEvent.name: SyntheticEvent

params.name: cfg
params.description: Implementation pieces and configuration

constructors.description:
Wrapper class for the integration of new events into the YUI event infrastructure. Don't instantiate this object directly, use Y.Event.define( type, config ).

The configuration object must include the event type, and should include implementation methods for on and detach. This is the full list of configuration properties:

type
REQUIRED. The name of the synthetic event. What goes node.on(HERE, callback ).
on
function ( node, subscription, fireEvent ) The implementation logic for subscription. Any special setup you need to do to create the environment for the event being fired. E.g. native DOM event subscriptions. Store subscription related objects and information on the subscription object. When the criteria have been met to fire the synthetic event, call fireEvent.fire().
detach
function ( node, subscription, fireEvent ) The implementation logic for cleaning up a detached subscription. E.g. detach any DOM subscriptions done in on.
publishConfig
(Object) The configuration object that will be used to instantiate the underlying CustomEvent. By default, the event is defined with emitFacade: true so subscribers will receive a DOM-like event object.
processArgs
function ( argArray ) Optional method to extract any additional arguments from the subscription signature. Using this allows on signatures like node.on( "hover", overCallback, outCallback ). Be sure that the args passed in is pruned of any additional arguments using, for example, argArray.splice(2,1);. Data returned from the function will be stored on the subscription object passed to on and detach under subscription._extra.

on.description: Initial receiver of the event subscription. Passes off control to the implementation on specified in the constructor configuration after setting up the boiler plate code necessary for clean detaching and destruction in the Event infrastructure. Note that the implementation function specified in the configuration will be called once for each node passed in el, and each will be a Node instance.

params.name: type
params.description: the synthetic event name

params.name: fn
params.description: the callback function

params.name: el
params.description: subscription target(s)

detach.description: Initial receiver of the event detach. Passes off control to the implementation detach specified in the constructor configuration after doing the necessary infrastructure cleanup. Note that the implementation function specified in the configuration will be called once for each node passed in el, and each will be a Node instance.
detach.param: type { String } the synthetic event name

params.name: type
params.description: the synthetic event name

params.name: fn
params.description: the callback function

params.name: el
params.description: subscription target(s)

_init.param: cfg {Object} The configuration object passed to the constructor

params.name: cfg
params.description: The configuration object passed to the constructor

return.description: null by default, but override to return useful data

_processArgs.description: Stub implementation. Specify this in the configuration object passed to the constructor (rather, passed to Y.Event.define).
_processArgs.param: args {Array} Array of arguments passed to on

params.name: args
params.description: Array of arguments passed to on

SyntheticEvent.description:

The configuration object must include the event type, and should include implementation methods for on and detach. This is the full list of configuration properties:

REQUIRED. The name of the synthetic event. What goes node.on(HERE, callback ).

E.g. native DOM event subscriptions. Store subscription related objects and information on the subscription object. When the criteria have been met to fire the synthetic event, call fireEvent.fire().
detach

Be sure that the args passed in is pruned of any additional arguments using, for example, argArray.splice(2,1);. Data returned from the function will be stored on the subscription object passed to on and detach under subscription._extra.

ignore.description: Fires when a test has been ignored.

testsuitebegin.description:
Fires when a test suite is opened but before the first 
test is executed.

testsuitecomplete.description:
Fires when all test cases in a test suite have been
completed.

pass.description: Fires when a test has passed.

fail.description: Fires when a test has failed.

complete.description: Fires when all test suites and test cases have been completed.

disableLogging.description:
Disable logging via Y.log(). Test output will not be visible unless
TestRunner events are subscribed to.

return.description: Results of the execution with properties passed, failed, and total.

_run.description: Runs a test case or test suite, returning the results.
_run.param: {Y.Test.Case|Y.Test.Suite} testObject The test case or test suite to run.

params.name: testObject
params.description: The test case or test suite to run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is running, false if not.

isRunning.description:
Indicates that the TestRunner is busy running tests and therefore can't
be stopped and results cannot be gathered.

setName.description:
The name assigned to the master suite of the TestRunner. This is the name
that is output as the root's name when results are retrieved.
setName.param: {String} name The name of the result set.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the result set.

return.description:
Either the coverage object or, if a coverage
format is specified, a string representing the results in that format.

getCoverage.description:
Returns the coverage report for the files that have been executed.
This returns only coverage information for files that have been
instrumented using YUI Test Coverage and only those that were run
in the same pass.
getCoverage.param: {Function} format (Optional) A coverage format to return results in.

params.name: format
params.description: (Optional) A coverage format to return results in.

_logEvent.param: {Object} event The event object for the event.

params.name: event
params.description: The event object for the event.

_addTestCaseToTestTree.description: Adds a test case to the test tree as a child of the specified node.
_addTestCaseToTestTree.param: {TestNode} parentNode The node to add the test case to as a child.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to add the test case to as a child.

params.name: testCase
params.description: The test case to add.

return.description: The name of the result set.

getName.description: Retrieves the name of the current result set.

resume.description: Resumes the TestRunner after wait() was called.
resume.param:
{Function} segment The function to run as the rest
of the haulted test.

params.name: segment
params.description:
The function to run as the rest
of the haulted test.

return.description:
Either the results object or, if a test format is 
passed as the argument, a string representing the results in a specific
format.

getResults.description:
Returns the last complete results set from the TestRunner. Null is returned
if the TestRunner is running or no tests have been run.
getResults.param: {Function} format (Optional) A test format to return the results in.

params.name: format
params.description: (Optional) A test format to return the results in.

enableLogging.description:
Enable logging via Y.log(). Test output is published and can be read via
logreader.

_buildTestTree.description:
Builds the test tree based on items in the master suite. The tree is a hierarchical
representation of the test suites, test cases, and test functions. The resulting tree
is stored in _root and the pointer _cur is set to the root initially.

_addTestSuiteToTestTree.description: Adds a test suite to the test tree as a child of the specified node.
_addTestSuiteToTestTree.param: {TestNode} parentNode The node to add the test suite to as a child.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to add the test suite to as a child.

params.name: testSuite
params.description: The test suite to add.

_handleTestObjectComplete.description:
Handles the completion of a test object's tests. Tallies test results 
from one level up to the next.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test object.

_handleTestObjectComplete.param: {TestNode} node The TestNode representing the test object.

add.description: Adds a test suite or test case to the list of test objects to run.
add.param: testObject Either a TestCase or a TestSuite that should be run.

params.name: testObject
params.description: Either a TestCase or a TestSuite that should be run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is waiting, false if not.

isWaiting.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting for a test to resume

return.description: The next node in the test tree or null if the end is reached.

_next.description: Retrieves the next node in the test tree.

run.param:
{Boolean} oldMode (Optional) Specifies that the <= 2.8 way of
internally managing test suites should be used.

params.name: oldMode
params.description:
(Optional) Specifies that the <= 2.8 way of
internally managing test suites should be used.

_handleError.description:
Handles an error as if it occurred within the currently executing
test. This is for mock methods that may be called asynchronously
and therefore out of the scope of the TestRunner. Previously, this
error would bubble up to the browser. Now, this method is used
to tell TestRunner about the error. This should never be called
by anyplace other than the Mock object.

params.name: error
params.description: The error object.

clear.description: Removes all test objects from the runner.

_runTest.description: Runs a single test based on the data provided in the node.
_runTest.param: {TestNode} node The TestNode representing the test to run.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test to run.

_runTest.name: _runTest

_running.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is currently running tests.

_root.description: Pointer to the root node in the test tree.

masterSuite.description: Suite on which to attach all TestSuites and TestCases to be run.

_log.description: Indicates if the TestRunner will log events or not.

_waiting.description:
Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting as a result of
wait() being called.

_cur.description: Pointer to the current node in the test tree.

_lastResults.description:
Holds copy of the results object generated when all tests are
complete.

Test.Runner.description:
Runs test suites and test cases, providing events to allowing for the
interpretation of test results.

_finalize.description: Called by the the helper for detecting script load in Safari

params.name: id

_autoPurge.description: Removes processed queues and corresponding nodes

params.name: id

return.description: the generated node

params.description: the url for the css file

_linkNode.param: url {string} the url for the css file

return.description: an object containing info about the transaction

script.description:
Fetches and inserts one or more script nodes into the head
of the current document or the document in a specified window.
script.param: url {string|string[]} the url or urls to the script(s)

params.name: url
params.description: the url or urls to the script(s)

params.name: opts
params.description:
Options:
onSuccess
callback to execute when the script(s) are finished loading The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onTimeout
callback to execute when a timeout occurs. The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onEnd
a function that executes when the transaction finishes, regardless of the exit path
onFailure
callback to execute when the script load operation fails The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted successfully
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove any nodes that were inserted
context
the execution context for the callbacks
win
a window other than the one the utility occupies
autopurge
setting to true will let the utilities cleanup routine purge the script once loaded
purgethreshold
The number of transaction before autopurge should be initiated
data
data that is supplied to the callback when the script(s) are loaded.
insertBefore
node or node id that will become the new node's nextSibling
charset
Node charset, default utf-8 (deprecated, use the attributes config)
attributes
An object literal containing additional attributes to add to the link tags
timeout
Number of milliseconds to wait before aborting and firing the timeout event
  Y.Get.script(
  ["http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/yahoo/yahoo-min.js",
   "http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/event/event-min.js"], {
    onSuccess: function(o) {
      this.log("won't cause error because Y is the context");
      Y.log(o.data); // foo
      Y.log(o.nodes.length === 2) // true
      // o.purge(); // optionally remove the script nodes immediately
    },
    onFailure: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction failed");
    },
    onTimeout: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction timed out");
    },
    data: "foo",
    timeout: 10000, // 10 second timeout
    context: Y, // make the YUI instance
    // win: otherframe // target another window/frame
    autopurge: true // allow the utility to choose when to remove the nodes
    purgetheshold: 1 // purge previous transaction before next transaction
  });

OverlayContextPanel.name: OverlayContextPanel

arrow.description: Position where the arrow will be placed. See showArrow. If it's not set, it will get the value set on the align point. Here is a list of valid arrows 'bc', 'bl', 'br', 'cc', 'lb', 'lc', 'lt', 'rb', 'rc', 'rl'.

stack.description: Gives stacking habilities to the OverlayContextPanel.

showArrow.description: If true the OverlayContextPanel will show an arrow positioned on the arrow point.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for OverlayContextPanel, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Customizable arrow
  • Optional animation when show or hide
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.OverlayContextPanel({
bodyContent: 'Here s a sample OverlayContextPanel.',
boundingBox: '#overlay-context-panel',
trigger: '#triggerButton',
cancellableHide: true,
hideDelay: 200,
hideOnDocumentClick: false,
anim: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayContextPanel.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

arrowChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'arrow' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

fixPointerColor.description:
OverlayContextPanel uses a imageless arrow, which involves some CSS technics.
This method is meant to fix the color of the borders of the arrow.

_syncElements.description: Sync the UI of the OverlayContextPanel elements.

getAlignPoint.description:
Normalize the align point value. The align point 'cc' is not a valid
position for the arrow and then it's normalized to the 'bc' point.

Plugin.DDConstrained.name: Plugin.DDConstrained

tickX.description: The X tick offset the drag node should snap to on each drag move. False for no ticks. Default: false

tickY.description: The Y tick offset the drag node should snap to on each drag move. False for no ticks. Default: false

gutter.description: CSS style string for the gutter of a region (supports negative values): '5 0' (sets top and bottom to 5px, left and right to 0px), '1 2 3 4' (top 1px, right 2px, bottom 3px, left 4px)

tickYArray.description: An array of page coordinates to use as Y ticks for drag movement.

constrain2node.description: Will attempt to constrain the drag node to the boundaries of this node.

stickX.description: Stick the drag movement to the X-Axis. Default: false

stickY.description: Stick the drag movement to the Y-Axis

constrain2region.description: An Object Literal containing a valid region (top, right, bottom, left) of page positions to constrain the drag node to.

cacheRegion.description: Should the region be cached for performace. Default: true

constrain.description:
Will attempt to constrain the drag node to the boundaries. Arguments:
'view': Contrain to Viewport
'#selector_string': Constrain to this node
'{Region Object}': An Object Literal containing a valid region (top, right, bottom, left) of page positions

constrain2view.description: Will attempt to constrain the drag node to the boundaries of the viewport region.

tickXArray.description: An array of page coordinates to use as X ticks for drag movement.

constructors.description: Plugin for the dd-drag module to add the constraining methods to it. It supports constraining to a node or viewport. It supports tick based moves and XY axis constraints.

params.description: The XY to check if it's in the current region, if it isn't inside the region, it will reset the xy array to be inside the region.

return.description: The calced XY coords

params.name: xy
params.description: The XY coords for the Drag

params.name: r
params.description: The optional region that we are bound to.

_checkTicks.param: {Array} xy The XY coords for the Drag

getRegion.description: Get the active region: viewport, node, custom region
getRegion.param: {Boolean} inc Include the node's height and width

params.name: inc
params.description: Include the node's height and width

align.description: Modifies the Drag.actXY method from the after drag:align event. This is where the constraining happens.

_handleStart.description: Fires on drag:start and clears the _regionCache

return.description: True if the XY is inside the region, false otherwise.

inRegion.description: Checks if the XY passed or the dragNode is inside the active region.
inRegion.param: {Array} xy Optional XY to check, if not supplied this.get('dragNode').getXY() is used.

params.description: Optional XY to check, if not supplied this.get('dragNode').getXY() is used.

_cacheRegion.description: Get's the region and caches it, called from window.resize and when the cache is null

_regionCache.description: Store a cache of the region that we are constraining to

NS.description: The Constrained instance will be placed on the Drag instance under the con namespace.

Plugin.DDConstrained.description: Plugin for the dd-drag module to add the constraining methods to it. It supports constraining to a node or viewport. It supports tick based moves and XY axis constraints.

AutoComplete.name: AutoComplete

queryQuestionMark.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.

forceSelection.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.

typeAheadDelay.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.

schemaType.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.

applyLocalFilter.description: If set to true, the filterResults method will be run on the response from the data source.

dataSourceType.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.

queryMatchCase.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.

typeAhead.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.

delimChar.description:
The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used
is a ",".

input.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.

alwaysShowContainer.description:
Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the 
user is requesting them.

schema.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.

minQueryLength.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.

matchKey.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.

queryMatchContains.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.

suppressInputUpdate.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.

dataSource.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.

uniqueName.description: The unique ID of the input element.

autoHighlight.description:
Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are
made visible.

queryInterval.description:
When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled,
AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a
query if the value has changed.

maxResultsDisplayed.description: The maximum number of results to display.

queryDelay.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for AutoComplete, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Presenting users choices based on their input
  • Separating selected items
  • Keyboard interaction for selecting items
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.AutoComplete({
dataSource: [['AL', 'Alabama', 'The Heart of Dixie'],
['AK', 'Alaska', 'The Land of the Midnight Sun'],
['AZ', 'Arizona', 'The Grand Canyon State']],
schema: {
resultFields: ['key', 'name', 'description']
},
matchKey: 'name',
delimChar: ',',
typeAhead: true,
contentBox: '#myAutoComplete'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for AutoComplete.

renderUI.description: Create the DOM structure for the AutoComplete. Lifecycle.

AutoComplete.ATTRS.description:
Static property used to define the default attribute
configuration for the AutoComplete.

AutoComplete.NAME.description: Static property provides a string to identify the class.

AutoComplete.description:
A base class for AutoComplete, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Presenting users choices based on their input
  • Separating selected items
  • Keyboard interaction for selecting items
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.AutoComplete({
dataSource: [['AL', 'Alabama', 'The Heart of Dixie'],
['AK', 'Alaska', 'The Land of the Midnight Sun'],
['AZ', 'Arizona', 'The Grand Canyon State']],
schema: {
resultFields: ['key', 'name', 'description']
},
matchKey: 'name',
delimChar: ',',
typeAhead: true,
contentBox: '#myAutoComplete'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for AutoComplete.

stringify.description:
Converts an arbitrary value to a JSON string representation.

Objects with cyclical references will trigger an exception.

If a whitelist is provided, only matching object keys will be included. Alternately, a replacer function may be passed as the second parameter. This function is executed on every value in the input, and its return value will be used in place of the original value. This is useful to serialize specialized objects or class instances.

If a positive integer or non-empty string is passed as the third parameter, the output will be formatted with carriage returns and indentation for readability. If a String is passed (such as "\t") it will be used once for each indentation level. If a number is passed, that number of spaces will be used.
stringify.param: o {MIXED} any arbitrary value to convert to JSON string

params.name: o
params.description: any arbitrary value to convert to JSON string

params.name: w
params.description:
(optional) whitelist of acceptable object
keys to include, or a replacer function to modify the
raw value before serialization

params.name: ind
params.description:
(optional) indentation character or depth of
spaces to format the output.

return.description: the \unnnn escapement of the character

Replaces specific unicode characters with their appropriate \unnnn
format. Some browsers ignore certain characters during eval.

_revive.description:
Traverses nested objects, applying a reviver function to each (key,value)
from the scope if the key:value's containing object.  The value returned

If the value returned is undefined, the key will be omitted from the
returned object.

_BRACKETS.description:
Third step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to remove all open
square brackets following a colon, comma, or at the beginning of the
string.

_UNICODE_EXCEPTIONS.description:
Replace certain Unicode characters that JavaScript may handle incorrectly
during eval--either by deleting them or treating them as line
endings--with escape sequences.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This regex will be used to modify the input if a match is
found.

useNativeParse.description:
Leverage native JSON parse if the browser has a native implementation.
In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues section in the
JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true for browsers with
native JSON support.

JSON.useNativeStringify.description:
Leverage native JSON stringify if the browser has a native
implementation.  In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues
section in the JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true
for browsers with native JSON support.

_UNSAFE.description:
Final step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to test the string left
after all previous replacements for invalid characters.

_ESCAPES.description:
First step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all escape
sequences (i.e. "\\", etc) with '@' characters (a non-JSON character).

_VALUES.description:
Second step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all simple
values with ']' characters.

Native.description: Alias to native browser implementation of the JSON object if available.

JSON.description:
The JSON module adds support for serializing JavaScript objects into JSON strings and parsing JavaScript objects from strings in JSON format.

The JSON namespace is added to your YUI instance including static methods Y.JSON.parse(..) and Y.JSON.stringify(..).

The functionality and method signatures follow the ECMAScript 5 specification. In browsers with native JSON support, the native implementation is used.

The json module is a rollup of json-parse and json-stringify.

As their names suggest, json-parse adds support for parsing JSON data (Y.JSON.parse) and json-stringify for serializing JavaScript data into JSON strings (Y.JSON.stringify). You may choose to include either of the submodules individually if you don't need the complementary functionality, or include the rollup for both.

params.description: Date.

params.type:
Object} (Optional) Object literal of configuration values:
format {String} (Optional)

Any strftime string is supported, such as "%I:%M:%S %p". strftime has several format specifiers defined by the Open group at http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/strftime.html PHP added a few of its own, defined at http://www.php.net/strftime

This javascript implementation supports all the PHP specifiers and a few more. The full list is below.

If not specified, it defaults to the ISO 8601 standard date format: %Y-%m-%d. This may be overridden by the deprecated Y.config.dateFormat property.

%a
abbreviated weekday name according to the current locale
%A
full weekday name according to the current locale
%b
abbreviated month name according to the current locale
%B
full month name according to the current locale
%c
preferred date and time representation for the current locale
%C
century number (the year divided by 100 and truncated to an integer, range 00 to 99)
%d
day of the month as a decimal number (range 01 to 31)
%D
same as %m/%d/%y
%e
day of the month as a decimal number, a single digit is preceded by a space (range " 1" to "31")
%F
same as %Y-%m-%d (ISO 8601 date format)
%g
like %G, but without the century
%G
The 4-digit year corresponding to the ISO week number
%h
same as %b
%H
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 00 to 23)
%I
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 01 to 12)
%j
day of the year as a decimal number (range 001 to 366)
%k
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 0 to 23); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %H.)
%l
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 1 to 12); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %I.)
%m
month as a decimal number (range 01 to 12)
%M
minute as a decimal number
%n
newline character
%p
either "AM" or "PM" according to the given time value, or the corresponding strings for the current locale
%P
like %p, but lower case
%r
time in a.m. and p.m. notation equal to %I:%M:%S %p
%R
time in 24 hour notation equal to %H:%M
%s
number of seconds since the Epoch, ie, since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC
%S
second as a decimal number
%t
tab character
%T
current time, equal to %H:%M:%S
%u
weekday as a decimal number [1,7], with 1 representing Monday
%U
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Sunday as the first day of the first week
%V
The ISO 8601:1988 week number of the current year as a decimal number, range 01 to 53, where week 1 is the first week that has at least 4 days in the current year, and with Monday as the first day of the week.
%w
day of the week as a decimal, Sunday being 0
%W
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Monday as the first day of the first week
%x
preferred date representation for the current locale without the time
%X
preferred time representation for the current locale without the date
%y
year as a decimal number without a century (range 00 to 99)
%Y
year as a decimal number including the century
%z
numerical time zone representation
%Z
time zone name or abbreviation
%%
a literal "%" character
locale {String
params.name: oConfig
params.description:
(Deprecated, optional)
Deprecated - use Y.config.lang instead, which provides access to a much larger set of built-in languages. The locale to use when displaying days of week, months of the year, and other locale specific strings. If not specified, this defaults to "en" (though this may be overridden by the deprecated Y.config.locale). The following locales are built in:
en
English
en-US
US English
en-GB
British English
en-AU
Australian English (identical to British English)
More locales may be added by subclassing of the deprecated Y.DataType.Date.Locale["en"]. See Y.DataType.Date.Locale for more information.

OverlayContext.name: OverlayContext

currentNode.description: OverlayContext allow multiple elements to be the trigger, the currentNode stores the current active one.

hideOn.description: The event which is responsible to hide the OverlayContext.

hideOnDocumentClick.description: If true the instance is registered on the OverlayContextManager static class and will be hide when the user click on document.

cancellableHide.description:
Cancel auto hide delay if the user interact with the Overlay
(focus, click, mouseover)

showDelay.description:
Number of milliseconds after the show method is invoked to show the
OverlayContext.

visible.description: If true the OverlayContext is visible by default after the render phase. Inherited from Overlay.

trigger.description:
Node, NodeList or Selector which will be used as trigger elements
to show or hide the OverlayContext.

showOn.description: The event which is responsible to show the OverlayContext.

hideDelay.description:
Number of milliseconds after the hide method is invoked to hide the
OverlayContext.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for OverlayContext, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Able to display an Overlay at a specified corner of an element trigger
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.OverlayContext({
boundingBox: '#OverlayBoundingBox',
hideOn: 'mouseleave',
showOn: 'mouseenter',
trigger: '.menu-trigger'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayContext.

_cancelAutoHide.description:
Cancel hide event if the user does some interaction with the
OverlayContext (focus, click or mouseover).

_invokeHideTaskOnInteraction.description: Invoke the hide event when the OverlayContext looses the focus.

updateCurrentNode.description: Update the currentNode with the align node or the event.currentTarget and in last case with the first item of the trigger.

params.name: eventType
params.description: Event type

bindUI.description: Bind the events on the OverlayContext UI. Lifecycle.

refreshAlign.description: Refreshes the alignment of the OverlayContext with the currentNode. See also align.

clearIntervals.description: Clear the intervals to show or hide the OverlayContext. See hideDelay and showDelay.

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

constrainChange.name: constrainChange
constrainChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'constrain' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

preventOverlap.description:
If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, 
constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping 
the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment
for corner based alignments

constrain.description:
The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be
set to true, to constrain to the viewport.

_bindUIPosConstrained.description:
Binds event listeners responsible for updating the UI state in response to Widget constrained positioning related state changes.

This method is invoked after bindUI is invoked for the Widget class using YUI's aop infrastructure.

_constrainOnXYChange.description:
The on change listener for the "xy" attribute. Modifies the event facade's
newVal property with the constrained XY value.
_constrainOnXYChange.param: {EventFacade} e The event facade for the attribute change

params.name: e
params.description: The event facade for the attribute change

_afterConstrainChange.description:
After change listener for the "constrain" attribute, responsible
for updating the UI, in response to attribute changes.

params.name: e
params.description: The event facade

enable or disable constraints listeners.description:
Updates the UI if enabling constraints, and sets up the xyChange event listeners
to constrain whenever the widget is moved. Disabling constraints removes the listeners.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable or disable constraints

_getRegion.description:
Utility method to normalize region retrieval from a node instance, 
or the viewport, if no node is provided.

params.name: node
params.description: Optional.

_setConstrain.description: The setter implementation for the "constrain" attribute.

params.name: val
params.description: The attribute value

constrain.param: {Array} xy Optional. The xy values to constrain

params.name: xy
params.description: Optional. The xy values to constrain

params.name: node
params.description: Optional. The node to constrain to, or true for the viewport

constrain.description:
Constrains the widget's bounding box to a node (or the viewport). If xy or node are not 
passed in, the current position and the value of "constrain" will be used respectively.
The widget's position will be changed to the constrained position.

return.description: The constrained value

_constrain.description:
The method which performs the actual constrain calculations for a given axis ("x" or "y") based
on the regions provided.

params.name: val
params.description: The value to constrain

params.name: axis
params.description: The axis to use for constrainment

params.name: nodeRegion
params.description: The region of the node to constrain

params.name: constrainingRegion
params.description: The region of the node (or viewport) to constrain to

return.description: The constrained xy values

getConstrainedXY.description:
Calculates the constrained positions for the XY positions provided, using
the provided node argument is passed in. If no node value is passed in, the value of 
the "constrain" attribute is used.
getConstrainedXY.param: {Array} xy The xy values to constrain

params.name: xy
params.description: The xy values to constrain

params.name: node
params.description: Optional. The node to constrain to, or true for the viewport

return.description: The constrained value

_preventOverlap.description:
The method which performs the preventOverlap calculations for a given axis ("x" or "y") based
on the value and regions provided.

params.name: val
params.description: The value being constrain

params.name: axis
params.description: The axis to being constrained

params.name: nodeRegion
params.description: The region of the node being constrained

params.name: constrainingRegion
params.description: The region of the node (or viewport) we need to constrain to

WidgetPositionConstrain._PREVENT_OVERLAP.description:
The set of positions for which to prevent
overlap.

WidgetPositionConstrain.ATTRS.description:
Static property used to define the default attribute 
configuration introduced by WidgetPositionConstrain.

WidgetPositionConstrain.description: A widget extension, which can be used to add constrained xy positioning support to the base Widget class, through the Base.build method. This extension requires that the WidgetPosition extension be added to the Widget (before WidgetPositionConstrain, if part of the same extension list passed to Base.build).

Lang.name: Lang

return.description: true if o is an array

isArray.description:
Determines whether or not the provided item is an array.
Returns false for array-like collections such as the
function arguments collection or HTMLElement collection
will return false.  You can use @see Array.test if you 
want to

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: the trimmed string

trim.description:
Returns a string without any leading or trailing whitespace.  If 
the input is not a string, the input will be returned untouched.

params.name: s
params.description: the string to trim

return.description: true if o is a date

isDate.description: Determines whether or not the supplied item is a date instance

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: true if o is a string

isString.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a string

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: true if o is a boolean

isBoolean.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: true if o is null

isNull.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is null

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: true if it is not null/undefined/NaN || false

isValue.description:
A convenience method for detecting a legitimate non-null value.
Returns false for null/undefined/NaN, true for other values, 
including 0/false/''

params.name: o
params.description: The item to test

return.description: true if o is a function

isFunction.description:
Determines whether or not the provided item is a function
Note: Internet Explorer thinks certain functions are objects:
var obj = document.createElement("object");
Y.Lang.isFunction(obj.getAttribute) // reports false in IE
var input = document.createElement("input"); // append to body
Y.Lang.isFunction(input.focus) // reports false in IE
You will have to implement additional tests if these functions
matter to you.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: true if o is a number

isNumber.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a legal number

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

return.description: the detected type

type.description:
Returns a string representing the type of the item passed in.
Known issues:
typeof HTMLElementCollection returns function in Safari, but
Y.type() reports object, which could be a good thing --
but it actually caused the logic in Y.Lang.isObject to fail.

params.name: o
params.description: the item to test

return.description: true if o is an object

isObject.description:
Determines whether or not the provided item is of type object
or function

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

params.name: failfn
params.description: fail if the input is a function

return.description: true if o is undefined

isUndefined.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is undefined

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test

Lang.description: Provides the language utilites and extensions used by the library

DD.Drag.name: DD.Drag

node.description: Y.Node instance to use as the element to initiate a drag operation

activeHandle.description: This config option is set by Drag to inform you of which handle fired the drag event (in the case that there are several handles): default false.

dragNode.description: Y.Node instance to use as the draggable element, defaults to node

move.description: If this is false, the drag element will not move with the cursor: default true. Can be used to "resize" the element.

target.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module has been loaded. It will make this node a drop target as well as draggable.

startCentered.description: Center the dragNode to the mouse position on drag:start: default false

offsetNode.description: Offset the drag element by the difference in cursor position: default true

handles.description: Array of valid handles to add. Adding something here will set all handles, even if previously added with addHandle

clickPixelThresh.description: The number of pixels to move to start a drag operation, default is 3.

bubbles.description: Controls the default bubble parent for this Drag instance. Default: Y.DD.DDM. Set to false to disable bubbling. Use bubbleTargets in config

groups.description: Array of groups to add this drag into.

lock.description: Set to lock this drag element so that it can't be dragged: default false.

dragMode.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module is active. It will set the dragMode (point, intersect, strict) of this Drag instance.

useShim.description: Use the protective shim on all drag operations: default true. Only works with dd-ddm, not dd-ddm-base.

dragging.description: This attribute is not meant to be used by the implementor, it is meant to be used as an Event tracker so you can listen for it to change.

data.description: A payload holder to store arbitrary data about this drag object, can be used to store any value.

primaryButtonOnly.description: By default a drag operation will only begin if the mousedown occurred with the primary mouse button. Setting this to false will allow for all mousedown events to trigger a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description: The number of milliseconds a mousedown has to pass to start a drag operation, default is 1000.

constructors.description: Provides the ability to drag a Node.

_groups.description: Storage Array for the groups this drag belongs to.

_handles.description: A private hash of the valid drag handles

_invalids.description: A private hash of the invalid selector strings

_ev_md.description: A private reference to the mousedown DOM event

target.description: This will be a reference to the Drop instance associated with this drag if the target: true config attribute is set..

_bubbleTargets.description: The default bubbleTarget for this object. Default: Y.DD.DDM

_startTime.description: The getTime of the mousedown event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_endTime.description: The getTime of the mouseup event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

region.description: A region object associated with this drag, used for checking regions while dragging.

mouseXY.description: The XY coords of the mousemove

_dragThreshMet.description: Private flag to see if the drag threshhold was met

actXY.description: The xy that the node will be set to. Changing this will alter the position as it's dragged.

deltaXY.description: The offset of the mouse position to the element's position

_invalidsDefault.description: A private hash of the default invalid selector strings: {'textarea': true, 'input': true, 'a': true, 'button': true, 'select': true}

lastXY.description: The position of the element as it's moving (for offset calculations)

_fromTimeout.description: Flag to determine if the drag operation came from a timeout

_ieSelectBack.description: We will hold a copy of the current "onselectstart" method on this property, and reset it after we are done using it.

realXY.description: The real xy position of the node.

addToGroup.description: Add this Drag instance to a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group additions.
addToGroup.param: {String} g The group to add this Drag Instance to.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to add this Drag Instance to.

_setStartPosition.description: Sets the current position of the Element and calculates the offset
_setStartPosition.param: {Array} xy The XY coords to set the position to.

params.name: xy
params.description: The XY coords to set the position to.

_fixDragStart.description: The function we use as the ondragstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer. This keeps IE from blowing up on images as drag handles.

_defDragFn.description: Default function for drag:drag. Fired from _moveNode.

params.name: ev
params.description: The drag:drag event

stopDrag.description: Method will forcefully stop a drag operation. For example calling this from inside an ESC keypress handler will stop this drag.

params.name: ev
params.description: The mousemove DOM event

validClick.description: Method first checks to see if we have handles, if so it validates the click against the handle. Then if it finds a valid handle, it checks it against the invalid handles list. Returns true if a good handle was used, false otherwise.

removeInvalid.description: Remove an invalid handle added by addInvalid
removeInvalid.param: {String} str The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

params.name: str
params.description: The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

addHandle.description: Add a handle to a drag element. Drag only initiates when a mousedown happens on this element.
addHandle.param: {String} str The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

initializer.description: Internal init handler

removeHandle.description: Remove a Selector added by addHandle
removeHandle.param: {String} str The selector for the handle to be removed.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector for the handle to be removed.

_handleMouseDownEvent.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_moveNode.description: This method performs the actual element move.

destructor.description: Lifecycle destructor, unreg the drag from the DDM and remove listeners

_ieSelectFix.description: The function we use as the onselectstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer

_defAlignFn.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.

params.name: e
params.description: The drag:align event.

_createEvents.description: This method creates all the events for this Event Target and publishes them so we get Event Bubbling.

_timeoutCheck.description: The method passed to setTimeout to determine if the clickTimeThreshold was met.

removeFromGroup.description: Remove this Drag instance from a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group removals.
removeFromGroup.param: {String} g The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

_fixIEMouseUp.description: This method copies the _ieSelectFix property back to the onselectstart listner on the document.

_alignNode.description: This method performs the alignment before the element move.
_alignNode.param: {Array} eXY The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

params.name: eXY
params.description: The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

_prevEndFn.description: Handler for preventing the drag:end event. It will reset the node back to it's start position

_prep.description: Attach event listners and add classname

addInvalid.description: Add a selector string to test the handle against. If the test passes the drag operation will not continue.
addInvalid.param: {String} str The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

_defMouseDownFn.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_handleMouseUp.description: Handler for the mouseup DOM event

_align.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.
_align.param: {Array} xy The xy coords to align with.

params.name: xy
params.description: The xy coords to align with.

_handleTarget.description: Attribute handler for the target config attribute.

_unprep.description: Detach event listeners and remove classname

TreeNode.name: TreeNode

prevSibling.description: Previous sibling of the current TreeNode.

ownerTree.description: TreeView which contains the current TreeNode.

leaf.description:
Whether the TreeNode could have children or not (i.e. if any
children is present the TreeNode is a leaf).

expanded.description: Whether the TreeNode is expanded by default.

nextSibling.description: Next sibling of the current TreeNode.

parentNode.description: Parent node of the current TreeNode.

draggable.description: If true the TreeNode is draggable.

labelEl.description: Label element to house the label attribute.

constructors.description:
A base class for TreeNode, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • The node for the TreeView component
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.TreeNode({
boundingBox: ''
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for TreeNode.

Dialog.name: Dialog

draggable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be draggable.

dragInstance.description: Stores the Drag instance for the A.DD.Drag used by this Dialog.

resizable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be resizable.

destroyOnClose.description: Invoke the destroy method when the dialog is closed (i.e., remove the Dialog boundingBox from the body, purge events etc).

resizableInstance.description: Stores the Drag instance for the Resize used by this Dialog.

buttons.description:
Array of object literals, each containing a set of properties defining a button to be appended into the Dialog's footer. Each button object in the buttons array can have two properties:

text:
The text that will display on the face of the button. The text can include HTML, as long as it is compliant with HTML Button specifications.
handler:
A reference to a function that should fire when the button is clicked. (In this case scope of this function is always its Dialog instance.)

modal.description: True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that will not be removed until the Dialog is dismissed. Uses OverlayMask.

close.description: If true the close icon will be displayed on the Dialog header.

constrain2view.description:
Will attempt to constrain the dialog to the boundaries of the
viewport region.

stack.description: If true give stacking habilities to the Dialog.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Dialog, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Emulate the behavior of an dialog window using a floating, draggable HTML element
  • Interface for easily gathering information from the user without leaving the underlying page context
  • Using the IOPlugin, supports the submission of form data either through an XMLHttpRequest, through a normal form submission, or through a fully script-based response
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Dialog({
bodyContent: 'Dialog body',
centered: true,
constrain2view: true,
destroyOnClose: true,
draggable: true,
height: 250,
resizable: false,
stack: true,
title: 'Dialog title',
width: 500
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Dialog.

Plugin.Host.description:
An augmentable class, which provides the augmented class with the ability to host plugins. It adds plug and unplug methods to the augmented class, which can be used to add or remove plugins from instances of the class.

Plugins can also be added through the constructor configuration object passed to the host class' constructor using the "plugins" property. Supported values for the "plugins" property are those defined by the plug method. For example the following code would add the AnimPlugin and IOPlugin to Overlay (the plugin host):

var o = new Overlay({plugins: [ AnimPlugin, {fn:IOPlugin, cfg:{section:"header"}}]});

Plug.Host's protected _initPlugins and _destroyPlugins methods should be invoked by the host class at the appropriate point in the host's lifecyle.

ImageGallery.name: ImageGallery

paginator.description: Paginator configuration Object. The Paginator handles the thumbnails control.

paused.description: If true the slide show is paused.

pausedLabel.description: Label to display when the slide show is paused.

showPlayer.description: Show the player controls (i.e., pause and show buttons).

useOriginalImage.description: If true will use the original image as thumbnails.

playing.description: If true the slide show is playing.

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds to change to the next image.

playingLabel.description: Label to display when the slide show is playing.

repeat.description: Restart the navigation when reach the last element.

paginatorEl.description: Element which contains the Paginator with the thumbnails.

toolbar.default: Generated Toolbar with a play, and pause buttons.
toolbar.description: Toolbar with a play, and pause buttons.

autoPlay.description: If true the slide show will be played when the ImageGallery is displayed.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for ImageGallery, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Displays an image in a Overlay
  • Displays list of thumbnails of the images as a control
  • Slide show functionalities (i.e., play, pause etc)
  • Keyboard navigation support
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.ImageGallery({
links: '#gallery1 a',
caption: 'Liferay Champion Soccer',
captionFromTitle: true,
preloadNeighborImages: true,
preloadAllImages: true,
showInfo: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ImageGallery.

Intl.name: Intl

return.description: boolean true if successful, false if not.

setLang.description: Sets the active language for the given module. Returns false on failure, which would happen if the language had not been registered through the add() method.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

params.name: lang
params.description: The BCP 47 language tag.

return.description: String | Object A copy of the module's localized resources, or a single value if key is provided.

get.description:
Gets the module's localized resources for the currently active language (as provided by the getLang method).

Optionally, the localized resources for alternate languages which have been added to Intl (see the add method) can be retrieved by providing the BCP 47 language tag as the lang parameter.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

params.name: key
params.description: Optional. A single resource key. If not provided, returns a copy (shallow clone) of all resources.

params.name: lang
params.description: Optional. The BCP 47 language tag. If not provided, the module's currently active language is used.

return.description: The BCP 47 language tag.

getLang.description: Get the currently active language for the given module.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

return.description: The array of languages available.

getAvailableLangs.description:
Gets the list of languages for which localized resources are available for a given module, based on the module
meta-data (part of loader). If loader is not on the page, returns an empty array.
getAvailableLangs.param: {String} module The name of the module

params.description: The name of the module

params.description: The module name.

add.description: Register a hash of localized resources for the given module and language

return.description:
The available language that best matches the
preferred language list, or "".

lookupBestLang.description:
Returns the language among those available that
best matches the preferred language list, using the Lookup
algorithm of BCP 47.
If none of the available languages meets the user's preferences,
then "" is returned.
Extended language ranges are not supported.
lookupBestLang.param:
{String[] | String} preferredLanguages The list of preferred languages
in descending preference order, represented as BCP 47 language
tags. A string array or a comma-separated list.

params.description:

in descending preference order, represented as BCP 47 language
tags. A string array or a comma-separated list.

params.description:
The list of languages
that the application supports, represented as BCP 47 language
tags.

DatePickerSelect.name: DatePickerSelect

populateYear.description:
If true the select element for the year will be automatic
populated.

yearNode.description: DOM Node to display the year of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.

monthNode.description: DOM Node to display the month of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.

baseName.description:
A basename to identify the select elements from this
DatePickerSelect.

yearRange.description:
Year range to be displayed on the year select element. By default
it displays from -10 to +10 years from the current year.

selectWrapperNode.description: DOM Node to display the selects of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-select-wrapper.

visible.description: If true the Calendar is visible by default after the render phase. Inherited from OverlayContext.

trigger.description: Trigger element to open the calendar. Inherited from OverlayContext.

dayNode.description: DOM Node to display the day of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.

populateMonth.description:
If true the select element for the month will be automatic
populated.

appendOrder.description: The order the selects elements are appended to the srcNode.

buttonNode.description: DOM Node to display the button of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-buttonitem.

populateDay.description:
If true the select element for the days will be automatic
populated.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for DatePickerSelect, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Select a date from Calendar to select elements
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.DatePickerSelect({
srcNode: '#srcNodeId',
// locale: 'pt-br',
dateFormat: '%m/%d/%y',
yearRange: [ 1970, 2009 ]
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for DatePickerSelect.

StyleSheet.name: StyleSheet

params.name: seed
params.description:
a style or link node, its id, or a
name or guid of a StyleSheet, or a string of css text

params.name: name
params.description:
(optional) name to register instance for future static
access

constructors.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

enable.description: Enable all the rules in the sheet

StyleSheet.isValidSelector.description:
Determines if a selector string is safe to use. Used internally in set to prevent IE from locking up when attempting to add a rule for a "bad selector".

Bad selectors are considered to be any string containing unescaped `~!@$%^&()+=|{}[];'"?< or space. Also forbidden are . or # followed by anything other than an alphanumeric. Additionally -abc or .-abc or #_abc or '# ' all fail. There are likely more failure cases, so please file a bug if you encounter one.

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string

getCssText.description:
Get the current cssText for a rule or the entire sheet.  If the
selector param is supplied, only the cssText for that rule will be
returned, if found.  If the selector string targets multiple
selectors separated by commas, the cssText of the first rule only
will be returned.  If no selector string, the stylesheet's full
cssText will be returned.

params.name: sel
params.description: Selector string

isEnabled.description: Returns false if the StyleSheet is disabled.  Otherwise true.

disable.description:
Disable all the rules in the sheet.  Rules may be changed while the
StyleSheet is disabled.

set.description:
Set style properties for a provided selector string. If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If the selector string does not have a corresponding rule in the sheet, it will be added.

The object properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript names of style properties. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be set by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".
set.param: sel {String} the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: Object literal of style properties and new values

return.description: the static id

getId.description: Get the unique stamp for this StyleSheet instance

return.description:
false if no name or sheet is not a StyleSheet
instance. true otherwise.

StyleSheet.register.description: Registers a StyleSheet instance in the static registry by the given name
StyleSheet.register.param: name {String} the name to assign the StyleSheet in the registry

params.name: name
params.description: the name to assign the StyleSheet in the registry

params.name: sheet
params.description: The StyleSheet instance

unset.description:
Unset style properties for a provided selector string, removing their effect from the style cascade.

If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If there are no properties remaining in the rule after unsetting, the rule is removed.

The style property or properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript style property names. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be unset by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".
unset.param: sel {String} the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: style property name or Array of names

return.description: the resulting cssText string

StyleSheet.toCssText.description:
Converts an object literal of style properties and values into a string of css text. This can then be assigned to el.style.cssText.

The optional second parameter is a cssText string representing the starting state of the style prior to alterations. This is most often extracted from the eventual target's current el.style.cssText.
StyleSheet.toCssText.param: css {Object} object literal of style properties and values

params.name: css
params.description: object literal of style properties and values

params.name: cssText
params.description: (optional) starting cssText value

StyleSheet.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

YUI~oop.name: YUI~oop

return.description: the augmented object

augment.description:
Applies prototype properties from the supplier to the receiver.
The receiver can be a constructor or an instance.
augment.param: {Function} r  the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: ov
params.description:
if true, properties already on the receiver
will be overwritten if found on the supplier.

params.name: wl
params.description:
a whitelist.  If supplied, only properties in 
this list will be applied to the receiver.

params.name: args
params.description:
arg or arguments to apply to the supplier
constructor when initializing.

return.description: the YUI instance

extend.description:
Utility to set up the prototype, constructor and superclass properties to
support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.

params.name: r
params.description: the object to modify

params.name: s
params.description: the object to inherit

params.name: px
params.description: prototype properties to add/override

params.name: sx
params.description: static properties to add/override

return.description: the wrapped function

bind.description:
Returns a function that will execute the supplied function in the
supplied object's context, optionally adding any additional
supplied parameters to the beginning of the arguments collection the 
supplied to the function.
bind.param:
f {Function|String} the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context

params.name: args*
params.description:
0..n arguments to include before the arguments the 
function is executed with.

return.description: the cloned object

clone.description:
Deep obj/array copy.  Function clones are actually
wrappers around the original function.
Array-like objects are treated as arrays.
Primitives are returned untouched.  Optionally, a
function can be provided to handle other data types,
filter keys, validate values, etc.

params.name: o
params.description: what to clone

params.name: safe
params.description:
if true, objects will not have prototype
items from the source.  If false, they will.  In this case, the
original is initially protected, but the clone is not completely immune
from changes to the source object prototype.  Also, cloned prototype
items that are deleted from the clone will result in the value
of the source prototype being exposed.  If operating on a non-safe
clone, items should be nulled out rather than deleted.

params.name: f
c
params.description: optional execution context for f

params.name: owner
params.description:
Owner object passed when clone is iterating an
object.  Used to set up context for cloned functions.

return.description: the wrapped function

rbind.description:
Returns a function that will execute the supplied function in the
supplied object's context, optionally adding any additional
supplied parameters to the end of the arguments the function
is executed with.
rbind.param:
f {Function|String} the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context

params.name: args*
params.description:
0..n arguments to append to the end of arguments collection
supplied to the function

return.description: the YUI instance

each.description:
Executes the supplied function for each item in
a collection.  Supports arrays, objects, and
Y.NodeLists

params.name: o
params.description: the object to iterate

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to execute.  This function
receives the value, key, and object as parameters

params.name: proto
params.description:
if true, prototype properties are
iterated on objects

return.description: the extended object

aggregate.description:
Applies object properties from the supplier to the receiver.  If
the target has the property, and the property is an object, the target
object will be augmented with the supplier's value.  If the property
is an array, the suppliers value will be appended to the target.
aggregate.param: {Function} r  the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: ov
params.description:
if true, properties already on the receiver
will be overwritten if found on the supplier.

params.name: wl
params.description:
a whitelist.  If supplied, only properties in 
this list will be applied to the receiver.

params.name: object

body and footer section support.
